DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Zinc supplement may lower cadmium level smoker may help prevent DNA damage . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study well zinc supplement work lower cadmium level smoker .
DOC.brief_title: Zinc Supplements Lowering Cadmium Levels Smokers
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine whether zinc supplement reduce cadmium level smoker . - Measure serum level cotinine ( biomarker smoke ) , zinc ( marker compliance ) , cadmium ( dependent variable ) 3 pre-supplementation visit 6 supplementation visit . - Determine whether serum cadmium level ( adjust serum level cotinine ) decrease supplementation VisiVite Smoker 's Formula . - Determine increase cadmium level blood cigarette smoker correlate decreased mismatch repair . - Determine administration zinc-containing supplement reverse cadmium-induced inhibition mismatch repair . OUTLINE : This open-label , nonrandomized study . Patients receive oral zinc supplement daily 12 week absence unacceptable toxicity . Blood , serum , urine collect weekly 3 week begin treatment week 5 , 6 , 9 , 12 , 15 , 17 biomarker/laboratory analysis . Samples examine cadmium , zinc , cotinine level atomic absorption spectrophotometry , expression mismatch repair protein ( MSH2 , MSH6 , MSH3 , MLH1 , PMS2 ) , level messenger RNA reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction , microsatellite instability gel electrophoresis . After completion study therapy , patient follow 5 week .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Currently smoke ≥ 1 pack ( 20 cigarette ) per day Baseline cadmium level ≥ 0.5 μg/L PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception No known gastrointestinal upset due zinc vitamin lozenges PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : At least 2 week since prior concurrent vitamin zinc supplement
